column1: Less commonly, meatal stenosis may also affect adult women.

Symptoms include: - Abnormal strength and direction of urine stream - Bed wetting - Bleeding (hematuria) at end of urination - Discomfort with urination or straining with urination - Incontinence (day or night) - Visible narrow opening in boys
In boys, a history and physical exam are enough to make the diagnosis.
In boys, a minor outpatient surgery called meatoplasty is the treatment of choice.
Call your health care provider if your child has symptoms of this disorder.
